body: Theodore, It was a very weird bug.  I was getting a "can't divide by zero" error and yet I already had a check in the function to make sure that it didn't divide by zero.  In any case, I put in yet another check and it fixed it in the attached file.  Thanks for finding the bug. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/nLML9an*avpLNyOfayC6cZuSbN1XlyCnpiqCv37DpaWFA1atiOkgbhwKBVPecPPPojSEYjt1pn3e32xmQUmNJoVQm1SoRb3w/FileWorking.PNG) -Chris
